comments.text:
Created attachment 552117
iframe_charts.zip

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110622131247

Steps to reproduce:

Issued a post request.
See the attached files. Just dump them in a directory served by a HTTP server (run "python -m SimpleHTTPServer" from this directory), and point Firefox to iframe_charts.html (http://localhost:8000/iframe_charts.html).


Actual results:

Both charts have a "Chart 1" title.


Expected results:

The second chart should have a "Chart 2" title. This is a post request, so I expected there will be no caching. But still, it seems the first request was cached, and the second request was taken from the cache. I even tried to add the onsubmit part that changes the action, so there will be less chances of caching, and still it's cached.

The same thing works on Chrome and IE8. Am I missing something here?
comments.author: yuval.ronen@gmail.com
comments.creator: yuval.ronen@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110622131247

Steps to reproduce:

Issued a post request.
See the attached files. Just dump them in a directory served by a HTTP server (run "python -m SimpleHTTPServer" from this directory), and point Firefox to iframe_charts.html (http://localhost:8000/iframe_charts.html).


Actual results:

Both charts have a "Chart 1" title.


Expected results:

The second chart should have a "Chart 2" title. This is a post request, so I expected there will be no caching. But still, it seems the first request was cached, and the second request was taken from the cache. I even tried to add the onsubmit part that changes the action, so there will be less chances of caching, and still it's cached.

The same thing works on Chrome and IE8. Am I missing something here?

comments.creator: yuval.ronen@gmail.com
comments.text: To make things a bit clearer, the issue, as far as I understand it, is that FF doesn't take into consideration the onsubmit event that changes the action URL.
comments.author: yuval.ronen@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: To make things a bit clearer, the issue, as far as I understand it, is that FF doesn't take into consideration the onsubmit event that changes the action URL.

comments.text:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:9.0a1) Gecko/20110918 Firefox/9.0a1

Reproducible on Ubuntu 11.04, Windows XP, 7 and Mac OS 10.7. The test result certainly is inconsistent with other browsers' behavior.

1. Load Chart 1-chart 1 should be displayed.
2. Load Chart 2-chart 1 is displayed instead.

Setting to new. Maybe someone will clarify this.
comments.author: virgil.dicu@softvision.ro
comments.creator: virgil.dicu@softvision.ro
